    • Method Detail

      • stringTimes

        public java.lang.String stringTimes(java.lang.String str,
                                    int n)
        Given a string and a non-negative int n, return a larger string that is n copies of the original string. stringTimes("Hi", 2) → "HiHi" stringTimes("Hi", 3) → "HiHiHi" stringTimes("Hi", 1) → "Hi"
        Parameters:
        str - string, can be any length
        n - int, its a non-negative number
        Returns:
        string, it is n copies of the original string

      • doubleX

        public boolean doubleX(java.lang.String str)
        Given a string, return true if the first instance of "x" in the string is immediately followed by another "x". doubleX("axxbb") → true doubleX("axaxax") → false doubleX("xxxxx") → true
        Parameters:
        str - string, may be any length
        Returns:
        boolean, it is true if the first instance of "x" in the string is immediately followed by another "x"

      • last2

        public int last2(java.lang.String str)
        Given a string, return the count of the number of times that a substring length 2 appears in the string and also as the last 2 chars of the string, so "hixxxhi" yields 1 (we won't count the end substring). last2("hixxhi") → 1 last2("xaxxaxaxx") → 1 last2("axxxaaxx") → 2
        Parameters:
        str - string, may be any length
        Returns:
        int, it is the count of the number of times that a substring length 2 appears in the string and also as the last 2 chars of the string

      • array123

        public boolean array123(int[] nums)
        Given an array of ints, return true if the sequence of numbers 1, 2, 3 appears in the array somewhere. array123([1, 1, 2, 3, 1]) → true array123([1, 1, 2, 4, 1]) → false array123([1, 1, 2, 1, 2, 3]) → true
        Parameters:
        nums - int array, may be any length
        Returns:
        boolean, it is true if the sequence of numbers 1, 2, 3 appears in the array somewhere

      • altPairs

        public java.lang.String altPairs(java.lang.String str)
        Given a string, return a string made of the chars at indexes 0,1, 4,5, 8,9 ... so "kittens" yields "kien". altPairs("kitten") → "kien" altPairs("Chocolate") → "Chole" altPairs("CodingHorror") → "Congrr"
        Parameters:
        str - string, may be any length
        Returns:
        string, made of the chars at indexes 0,1, 4,5, 8,9 ... so "kittens" yields "kien"

      • noTriples

        public boolean noTriples(int[] nums)
        Given an array of ints, we'll say that a triple is a value appearing 3 times in a row in the array. Return true if the array does not contain any triples. noTriples([1, 1, 2, 2, 1]) → true noTriples([1, 1, 2, 2, 2, 1]) → false noTriples([1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2, 1]) → false
        Parameters:
        nums - int array, may be any length
        Returns:
        boolean, it is true if the array does not contain any triples

      • frontTimes

        public java.lang.String frontTimes(java.lang.String str,
                                   int n)
        Given a string and a non-negative int n, we'll say that the front of the string is the first 3 chars, or whatever is there if the string is less than length 3. Return n copies of the front; frontTimes("Chocolate", 2) → "ChoCho" frontTimes("Chocolate", 3) → "ChoChoCho" frontTimes("Abc", 3) → "AbcAbcAbc
        Parameters:
        str - string, may be any length
        n - int, non-negative
        Returns:
        string, that the front of the string is the first 3 chars, or whatever is there if the string is less than length 3. Return n copies of the front

      • stringBits

        public java.lang.String stringBits(java.lang.String str)
        Given a string, return a new string made of every other char starting with the first, so "Hello" yields "Hlo". stringBits("Hello") → "Hlo" stringBits("Hi") → "H" stringBits("Heeololeo") → "Hello"
        Parameters:
        str - string, may be any length
        Returns:
        string, it made of every other char starting with the first

      • arrayCount9

        public int arrayCount9(int[] nums)
        Given an array of ints, return the number of 9's in the array. arrayCount9([1, 2, 9]) → 1 arrayCount9([1, 9, 9]) → 2 arrayCount9([1, 9, 9, 3, 9]) → 3
        Parameters:
        nums - int array, may be any length
        Returns:
        int, it is the number of 9's in the array

      • stringMatch

        public int stringMatch(java.lang.String a,
                       java.lang.String b)
        Given 2 strings, a and b, return the number of the positions where they contain the same length 2 substring. So "xxcaazz" and "xxbaaz" yields 3, since the "xx", "aa", and "az" substrings appear in the same place in both strings. stringMatch("xxcaazz", "xxbaaz") → 3 stringMatch("abc", "abc") → 2 stringMatch("abc", "axc") → 0
        Parameters:
        a - string, may be any length
        b - string, may be any length
        Returns:
        int, it is the number of the positions where they contain the same length 2 substring

      • stringYak

        public java.lang.String stringYak(java.lang.String str)
        Suppose the string "yak" is unlucky. Given a string, return a version where all the "yak" are removed, but the "a" can be any char. The "yak" strings will not overlap. stringYak("yakpak") → "pak" stringYak("pakyak") → "pak" stringYak("yak123ya") → "123ya"
        Parameters:
        str - string, can be any length
        Returns:
        string, it is where all the "yak" are removed, but the "a" can be any char

      • has271

        public boolean has271(int[] nums)
        Given an array of ints, return true if it contains a 2, 7, 1 pattern: a value, followed by the value plus 5, followed by the value minus 1. Additionally the 271 counts even if the "1" differs by 2 or less from the correct value. has271([1, 2, 7, 1]) → true has271([1, 2, 8, 1]) → false has271([2, 7, 1]) → true
        Parameters:
        nums - int array, may be any length
        Returns:
        boolean, it is true if it contains a 2, 7, 1 pattern

      • countXX

        public int countXX(java.lang.String str)
        Count the number of "xx" in the given string. We'll say that overlapping is allowed, so "xxx" contains 2 "xx". countXX("abcxx") → 1 countXX("xxx") → 2 countXX("xxxx") → 3
        Parameters:
        str - string, may be any length
        Returns:
        int, it counts the "xx" in the given string, overlapping is allowed

      • stringSplosion

        public java.lang.String stringSplosion(java.lang.String str)
        Given a non-empty string like "Code" return a string like "CCoCodCode". stringSplosion("Code") → "CCoCodCode" stringSplosion("abc") → "aababc" stringSplosion("ab") → "aab"
        Parameters:
        str - string, non-empty
        Returns:
        string, (eg: "Code" return a string like "CCoCodCode")

      • arrayFront9

        public boolean arrayFront9(int[] nums)
        Given an array of ints, return true if one of the first 4 elements in the array is a 9. The array length may be less than 4. arrayFront9([1, 2, 9, 3, 4]) → true arrayFront9([1, 2, 3, 4, 9]) → false arrayFront9([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]) → false
        Parameters:
        nums - int array, may be any length
        Returns:
        boolean, it is true if one of the first 4 elements in the array is a 9

      • stringX

        public java.lang.String stringX(java.lang.String str)
        Given a string, return a version where all the "x" have been removed. Except an "x" at the very start or end should not be removed. stringX("xxHxix") → "xHix" stringX("abxxxcd") → "abcd" stringX("xabxxxcdx") → "xabcdx"
        Parameters:
        str - string, may be any length
        Returns:
        string, it is where all the "x" have been removed from the original string. Except an "x" at the very start or end should not be removed.

      • array667

        public int array667(int[] nums)
        Given an array of ints, return the number of times that two 6's are next to each other in the array. Also count instances where the second "6" is actually a 7. array667([6, 6, 2]) → 1 array667([6, 6, 2, 6]) → 1 array667([6, 7, 2, 6]) → 1
        Parameters:
        nums - int array, may be any length
        Returns:
        int, it counts the number of times that two 6's are next to each other in the array. Also count instances where the second "6" is actually a 7.
